trans-unit.source: Use VPN profiles to deploy VPN settings to users and devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Use VPN profiles to deploy VPN settings to users and devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: You can use virtual private networks (VPNs) to give your users secure remote access to your company network.
trans-unit.target: You can use virtual private networks (VPNs) to give your users secure remote access to your company network.

trans-unit.source: Remote users can work as if their devices are physically connected to the network.
trans-unit.target: Remote users can work as if their devices are physically connected to the network.

trans-unit.source: Devices use a VPN connection profile to initiate a connection with the VPN server.
trans-unit.target: Devices use a VPN connection profile to initiate a connection with the VPN server.

trans-unit.source: Use *VPN profiles* in Microsoft Intune to deploy VPN settings to users and devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Use *VPN profiles* in Microsoft Intune to deploy VPN settings to users and devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: By deploying these settings, you minimize the end-user effort required to connect to resources on the company network.
trans-unit.target: By deploying these settings, you minimize the end-user effort required to connect to resources on the company network.

trans-unit.source: For example, assume that you want to provision all iOS devices with the settings required to connect to a file share on the corporate network.
trans-unit.target: For example, assume that you want to provision all iOS devices with the settings required to connect to a file share on the corporate network.

trans-unit.source: You create a VPN profile that contains the settings necessary to connect to the corporate network, and then you deploy this profile to all users who have iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: You create a VPN profile that contains the settings necessary to connect to the corporate network, and then you deploy this profile to all users who have iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: The users will see the VPN connection in the list of available networks and can connect with minimal effort.
trans-unit.target: The users will see the VPN connection in the list of available networks and can connect with minimal effort.

trans-unit.source: You can configure the following device types by using VPN profiles:
trans-unit.target: You can configure the following device types by using VPN profiles:

trans-unit.source: Devices that run Android 4 and later
trans-unit.target: Devices that run Android 4 and later

trans-unit.source: Devices that run iOS 8.0 and later
trans-unit.target: Devices that run iOS 8.0 and later

trans-unit.source: Devices that run Mac OS X 10.9 and later
trans-unit.target: Devices that run Mac OS X 10.9 and later

trans-unit.source: Enrolled devices that run Windows 8.1 and later
trans-unit.target: Enrolled devices that run Windows 8.1 and later

trans-unit.source: Devices that run Windows Phone 8.1 and later
trans-unit.target: Devices that run Windows Phone 8.1 and later

trans-unit.source: Devices that run Windows 10 desktop and mobile
trans-unit.target: Devices that run Windows 10 desktop and mobile

trans-unit.source: The VPN profile configuration options differ depending on the device type that you select.
trans-unit.target: The VPN profile configuration options differ depending on the device type that you select.

trans-unit.source: Intune supports creating VPN profiles that use the following connection types:
trans-unit.target: Intune supports creating VPN profiles that use the following connection types:

trans-unit.source: \* Without additional settings that are otherwise available for Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \* Without additional settings that are otherwise available for Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Before you can use VPN profiles deployed to a device, you must install the applicable VPN app for the profile.
trans-unit.target: Before you can use VPN profiles deployed to a device, you must install the applicable VPN app for the profile.

trans-unit.source: You can use the information in the [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md) topic to help you deploy the applicable app by using Intune.
trans-unit.target: You can use the information in the [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md) topic to help you deploy the applicable app by using Intune.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create custom VPN profiles by using URI settings in [Custom configurations for VPN profiles](custom-configurations-for-vpn-profiles.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create custom VPN profiles by using URI settings in [Custom configurations for VPN profiles](custom-configurations-for-vpn-profiles.md).

trans-unit.source: VPN profiles can use a number of different connection types and protocols from different manufacturers.
trans-unit.target: VPN profiles can use a number of different connection types and protocols from different manufacturers.

trans-unit.source: These connections are typically secured through one of two methods.
trans-unit.target: These connections are typically secured through one of two methods.

trans-unit.source: When you create the VPN profile, you choose a SCEP or PFX certificate profile that you previously created in Intune.
trans-unit.target: When you create the VPN profile, you choose a SCEP or PFX certificate profile that you previously created in Intune.

trans-unit.source: This is known as the identity certificate.
trans-unit.target: This is known as the identity certificate.

trans-unit.source: It's used to authenticate against a trusted certificate profile (or a root certificate) that you created to establish that the user’s device is allowed to connect.
trans-unit.target: It's used to authenticate against a trusted certificate profile (or a root certificate) that you created to establish that the user’s device is allowed to connect.

trans-unit.source: The trusted certificate is deployed to the computer that authenticates the VPN connection, typically, the VPN server.
trans-unit.target: The trusted certificate is deployed to the computer that authenticates the VPN connection, typically, the VPN server.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to create and use certificate profiles in Intune, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to create and use certificate profiles in Intune, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).

trans-unit.source: The user authenticates to the VPN server by providing a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: The user authenticates to the VPN server by providing a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Select a template for the new policy by expanding the relevant device type, and then choose the VPN profile for that device:
trans-unit.target: Select a template for the new policy by expanding the relevant device type, and then choose the VPN profile for that device:

trans-unit.source: **VPN Profile (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later)**
trans-unit.target: **VPN Profile (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later)**

trans-unit.source: You can create and deploy only a custom VPN profile policy.
trans-unit.target: You can create and deploy only a custom VPN profile policy.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to help you configure the VPN profile settings:
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to help you configure the VPN profile settings:

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the VPN profile to help you identify it in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the VPN profile to help you identify it in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the VPN profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the VPN profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the VPN profile.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the VPN profile.

trans-unit.source: This is the name that users will see in the list of available VPN connections on their devices.
trans-unit.target: This is the name that users will see in the list of available VPN connections on their devices.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the following connection types to use in the VPN profile: **Cisco AnyConnect** (not available for Windows 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.1), **Pulse Secure**, **F5 Edge Client**, **Dell SonicWALL Mobile Connect**, **CheckPoint Mobile VPN**.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the following connection types to use in the VPN profile: **Cisco AnyConnect** (not available for Windows 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.1), **Pulse Secure**, **F5 Edge Client**, **Dell SonicWALL Mobile Connect**, **CheckPoint Mobile VPN**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a description for the VPN server that devices will connect to.
trans-unit.target: Specify a description for the VPN server that devices will connect to.

trans-unit.source: When the connection type is **F5 Edge Client**, use the **Server list** field to specify a list of server descriptions and IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: When the connection type is **F5 Edge Client**, use the **Server list** field to specify a list of server descriptions and IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: Provide the IP address or fully qualified domain name of the VPN server that devices will connect to.
trans-unit.target: Provide the IP address or fully qualified domain name of the VPN server that devices will connect to.

trans-unit.source: When the connection type is **F5 Edge Client**, use the **Server list** field to specify a list of server descriptions and IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: When the connection type is **F5 Edge Client**, use the **Server list** field to specify a list of server descriptions and IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Add** to add a new VPN server to use for the VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Add** to add a new VPN server to use for the VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify which server will be the default server for the connection.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify which server will be the default server for the connection.

trans-unit.source: This option is displayed only when the connection type is **F5 Edge Client**.
trans-unit.target: This option is displayed only when the connection type is **F5 Edge Client**.

trans-unit.source: **Send all network traffic through the VPN connection**
trans-unit.target: **Send all network traffic through the VPN connection**

trans-unit.source: If you select this option, all network traffic is sent through the VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: If you select this option, all network traffic is sent through the VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: If you do not select this option, the client will dynamically negotiate the routes for split tunneling upon connecting to the third-party VPN server.
trans-unit.target: If you do not select this option, the client will dynamically negotiate the routes for split tunneling upon connecting to the third-party VPN server.

trans-unit.source: Only connections to the company network are sent over a VPN tunnel.
trans-unit.target: Only connections to the company network are sent over a VPN tunnel.

trans-unit.source: VPN tunneling is not used when you connect to resources on the Internet.
trans-unit.target: VPN tunneling is not used when you connect to resources on the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Select the authentication method that the VPN connection uses: **Certificates** or **Username and Password**.
trans-unit.target: Select the authentication method that the VPN connection uses: **Certificates** or **Username and Password**.

trans-unit.source: (**Username and Password** is not available when the connection type is Cisco AnyConnect.) The **Authentication method** option is not available for Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: (**Username and Password** is not available when the connection type is Cisco AnyConnect.) The **Authentication method** option is not available for Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: **Remember the user credentials at each logon**
trans-unit.target: **Remember the user credentials at each logon**

trans-unit.source: Select this option to ensure that the user credentials are remembered so that the user does not have to enter credentials each time a connection is established.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to ensure that the user credentials are remembered so that the user does not have to enter credentials each time a connection is established.

trans-unit.source: **Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)**
trans-unit.target: **Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)**

trans-unit.source: Select the client SCEP certificate that you previously created and that will be used to authenticate the VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Select the client SCEP certificate that you previously created and that will be used to authenticate the VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to use certificate profiles in Intune, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to use certificate profiles in Intune, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).

trans-unit.source: This option is displayed only when the authentication method is **Certificates**.
trans-unit.target: This option is displayed only when the authentication method is **Certificates**.

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the user role that has access to this connection.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the user role that has access to this connection.

trans-unit.source: A user role defines personal settings and options, and it enables or disables certain access features.
trans-unit.target: A user role defines personal settings and options, and it enables or disables certain access features.

trans-unit.source: This option is displayed only when the connection type is **Pulse Secure**.
trans-unit.target: This option is displayed only when the connection type is **Pulse Secure**.

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the authentication realm that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the authentication realm that you want to use.

trans-unit.source: An authentication realm is a grouping of authentication resources that the Pulse Secure connection type uses.
trans-unit.target: An authentication realm is a grouping of authentication resources that the Pulse Secure connection type uses.

trans-unit.source: This option is displayed only when the connection type is **Pulse Secure**.
trans-unit.target: This option is displayed only when the connection type is **Pulse Secure**.

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the login group or domain that you want to connect to.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the login group or domain that you want to connect to.

trans-unit.source: This option is displayed only when the connection type is **Dell SonicWALL Mobile Connect**.
trans-unit.target: This option is displayed only when the connection type is **Dell SonicWALL Mobile Connect**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a string (for example, "Contoso Fingerprint Code") that will be used to verify that the VPN server can be trusted.
trans-unit.target: Specify a string (for example, "Contoso Fingerprint Code") that will be used to verify that the VPN server can be trusted.

trans-unit.source: A fingerprint can be sent to the client so it knows to trust any server that presents the same fingerprint when connecting.
trans-unit.target: A fingerprint can be sent to the client so it knows to trust any server that presents the same fingerprint when connecting.

trans-unit.source: If the device doesn’t already have the fingerprint, it will prompt the user to trust the VPN server that they are connecting to while showing the fingerprint.
trans-unit.target: If the device doesn’t already have the fingerprint, it will prompt the user to trust the VPN server that they are connecting to while showing the fingerprint.

trans-unit.source: (The user manually verifies the fingerprint and chooses **trust** to connect.) This option is displayed only when the connection type is **CheckPoint Mobile VPN**.
trans-unit.target: (The user manually verifies the fingerprint and chooses **trust** to connect.) This option is displayed only when the connection type is **CheckPoint Mobile VPN**.

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you want to associate this VPN connection with an iOS or Mac OS X app so that the connection will be opened when the app is run.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you want to associate this VPN connection with an iOS or Mac OS X app so that the connection will be opened when the app is run.

trans-unit.source: You can associate the VPN profile with an app when you deploy the software.
trans-unit.target: You can associate the VPN profile with an app when you deploy the software.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: You can set up on-demand VPN for iOS 8.0 and later devices.
trans-unit.target: You can set up on-demand VPN for iOS 8.0 and later devices.

trans-unit.source: Instructions for setting this up are provided in [On-demand VPN for iOS devices](#on-demand-vpn-for-ios-devices).
trans-unit.target: Instructions for setting this up are provided in [On-demand VPN for iOS devices](#on-demand-vpn-for-ios-devices).

trans-unit.source: **Automatically detect proxy settings** (iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, and Windows Phone 8.1 only)
trans-unit.target: **Automatically detect proxy settings** (iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, and Windows Phone 8.1 only)

trans-unit.source: If your VPN server requires a proxy server for the connection, specify whether you want devices to automatically detect the connection settings.
trans-unit.target: If your VPN server requires a proxy server for the connection, specify whether you want devices to automatically detect the connection settings.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see your Windows Server documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see your Windows Server documentation.

trans-unit.source: **Use automatic configuration script** (iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, and Windows Phone 8.1 only)
trans-unit.target: **Use automatic configuration script** (iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, and Windows Phone 8.1 only)

trans-unit.source: If your VPN server requires a proxy server for the connection, specify whether you want to use an automatic configuration script to define the settings, and then specify a URL to the file that contains the settings.
trans-unit.target: If your VPN server requires a proxy server for the connection, specify whether you want to use an automatic configuration script to define the settings, and then specify a URL to the file that contains the settings.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see your Windows Server documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see your Windows Server documentation.

trans-unit.source: **Use proxy server** (iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, and Windows Phone 8.1 only)
trans-unit.target: **Use proxy server** (iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, and Windows Phone 8.1 only)

trans-unit.source: If your VPN server requires a proxy server for the connection, select this option, and then specify the address and port number of the proxy server.
trans-unit.target: If your VPN server requires a proxy server for the connection, select this option, and then specify the address and port number of the proxy server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see your Windows Server documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see your Windows Server documentation.

trans-unit.source: **Bypass proxy settings for local addresses** (iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, and Windows Phone 8.1 only)
trans-unit.target: **Bypass proxy settings for local addresses** (iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, and Windows Phone 8.1 only)

trans-unit.source: If your VPN server requires a proxy server for the connection, select this option if you do not want to use the proxy server for local addresses that you specify.
trans-unit.target: If your VPN server requires a proxy server for the connection, select this option if you do not want to use the proxy server for local addresses that you specify.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see your Windows Server documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see your Windows Server documentation.

trans-unit.source: **Custom XML** (Windows 8.1 and later, and Windows Phone 8.1 and later)
trans-unit.target: **Custom XML** (Windows 8.1 and later, and Windows Phone 8.1 and later)

trans-unit.source: Specify custom XML commands that configure the VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Specify custom XML commands that configure the VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: Example for **CheckPoint Mobile VPN**: <CheckPointVPN port="443" name="CheckPointSelfhost" sso="true" debug="3" />.
trans-unit.target: Example for **CheckPoint Mobile VPN**: <CheckPointVPN port="443" name="CheckPointSelfhost" sso="true" debug="3" />.

trans-unit.source: Refer to each manufacturer's VPN documentation for more information about how to write custom XML commands.
trans-unit.target: Refer to each manufacturer's VPN documentation for more information about how to write custom XML commands.

trans-unit.source: Specify one DNS suffix on each line.
trans-unit.target: Specify one DNS suffix on each line.

trans-unit.source: Each DNS suffix that you specify will be searched when connecting to a website by using a short name.
trans-unit.target: Each DNS suffix that you specify will be searched when connecting to a website by using a short name.

trans-unit.source: For example, specify the DNS suffixes **domain1.contoso.com** and **domain2.contoso.com**, visit the URL **http://mywebsite**, and the URLs **http://mywebsite.domain1.contoso.com** and **http://mywebsite.domain2.contoso.com** will be searched.
trans-unit.target: For example, specify the DNS suffixes **domain1.contoso.com** and **domain2.contoso.com**, visit the URL **http://mywebsite**, and the URLs **http://mywebsite.domain1.contoso.com** and **http://mywebsite.domain2.contoso.com** will be searched.

trans-unit.source: **Bypass VPN when connected to company Wi-Fi network** (Windows Phone 8.1 only)
trans-unit.target: **Bypass VPN when connected to company Wi-Fi network** (Windows Phone 8.1 only)

trans-unit.source: Select this option to specify that the VPN connection will not be used when the device is connected to the company Wi-Fi network.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to specify that the VPN connection will not be used when the device is connected to the company Wi-Fi network.

trans-unit.source: **Bypass VPN when connected to home Wi-Fi network** (Windows Phone 8.1 only)
trans-unit.target: **Bypass VPN when connected to home Wi-Fi network** (Windows Phone 8.1 only)

trans-unit.source: Select this option to specify that the VPN connection will not be used when the device is connected to a home Wi-Fi network.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to specify that the VPN connection will not be used when the device is connected to a home Wi-Fi network.

trans-unit.source: The following additional settings are available for Windows 10 desktop and mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: The following additional settings are available for Windows 10 desktop and mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Select which protocols, and which local and remote port and address ranges, will be enabled for the VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Select which protocols, and which local and remote port and address ranges, will be enabled for the VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: If you do not create a network traffic rule, all protocols, ports, and address ranges are enabled.
trans-unit.target: If you do not create a network traffic rule, all protocols, ports, and address ranges are enabled.

trans-unit.source: After you create a rule, the VPN connection will use only the protocols, ports, and address ranges that you specify in that rule.
trans-unit.target: After you create a rule, the VPN connection will use only the protocols, ports, and address ranges that you specify in that rule.

trans-unit.source: Select which routes will use the VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Select which routes will use the VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: Select which DNS servers the VPN connection will use after the connection is established.
trans-unit.target: Select which DNS servers the VPN connection will use after the connection is established.

trans-unit.source: Provide a list of apps that will automatically use the VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Provide a list of apps that will automatically use the VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: The type of app will determine the app identifier.
trans-unit.target: The type of app will determine the app identifier.

trans-unit.source: For a universal app, provide the package family name.
trans-unit.target: For a universal app, provide the package family name.

trans-unit.source: For a desktop app, provide the file path of the app.
trans-unit.target: For a desktop app, provide the file path of the app.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you secure all lists of apps that you compile for use in configuration of per-app VPN.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you secure all lists of apps that you compile for use in configuration of per-app VPN.

trans-unit.source: If an unauthorized user modifies your list and you import it into the per-app VPN app list, you will potentially authorize VPN access to apps that should not have access.
trans-unit.target: If an unauthorized user modifies your list and you import it into the per-app VPN app list, you will potentially authorize VPN access to apps that should not have access.

trans-unit.source: One way you can secure app lists is by using an access control list (ACL).
trans-unit.target: One way you can secure app lists is by using an access control list (ACL).

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of when you might use settings for corporate boundaries.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of when you might use settings for corporate boundaries.

trans-unit.source: If you want to enable VPN only for Remote Desktop, create a network traffic rule that allows traffic for protocol 27 on external port 3996.
trans-unit.target: If you want to enable VPN only for Remote Desktop, create a network traffic rule that allows traffic for protocol 27 on external port 3996.

trans-unit.source: No other traffic will use the VPN.
trans-unit.target: No other traffic will use the VPN.

trans-unit.source: Defining routes in corporate boundaries is useful when your VPN connection type does not allow you to define how traffic is handled in split tunneling.
trans-unit.target: Defining routes in corporate boundaries is useful when your VPN connection type does not allow you to define how traffic is handled in split tunneling.

trans-unit.source: In that case, use **Routes** to list the routes that will use the VPN.
trans-unit.target: In that case, use **Routes** to list the routes that will use the VPN.

trans-unit.source: You can restrict VPN usage for Windows 10 devices to specific apps by creating a custom OMA-URI setting.
trans-unit.target: You can restrict VPN usage for Windows 10 devices to specific apps by creating a custom OMA-URI setting.

trans-unit.source: The new policy appears in the **Configuration Policies** node of the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The new policy appears in the **Configuration Policies** node of the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: You can configure on-demand VPN for iOS 8.0 and later devices.
trans-unit.target: You can configure on-demand VPN for iOS 8.0 and later devices.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use per-app VPN and on-demand VPN in the same policy.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use per-app VPN and on-demand VPN in the same policy.

trans-unit.source: On the policy configuration page, find **On-demand rules for this VPN connection**.
trans-unit.target: On the policy configuration page, find **On-demand rules for this VPN connection**.

trans-unit.source: The columns are labeled **Match**, the condition that the rules check for, and **Action**, the action that the policy will trigger when the condition is matched.
trans-unit.target: The columns are labeled **Match**, the condition that the rules check for, and **Action**, the action that the policy will trigger when the condition is matched.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of matches that you can set up in the rule.
trans-unit.target: There are two types of matches that you can set up in the rule.

trans-unit.source: You can only configure one of these types per rule.
trans-unit.target: You can only configure one of these types per rule.

trans-unit.source: You can use full-qualified domain names such as *team. corp.contoso.com*, or use domains such as *contoso.com*, which is the equivalent of using * *.contoso.com*.
trans-unit.target: You can use full-qualified domain names such as *team. corp.contoso.com*, or use domains such as *contoso.com*, which is the equivalent of using * *.contoso.com*.

trans-unit.source: Optional :provide a URL string probe, which is a URL that the rule uses as a test.
trans-unit.target: Optional :provide a URL string probe, which is a URL that the rule uses as a test.

trans-unit.source: If the device on which this profile is installed is able to access this URL without redirection, the VPN will be established and the device will connect to the target URL.
trans-unit.target: If the device on which this profile is installed is able to access this URL without redirection, the VPN will be established and the device will connect to the target URL.

trans-unit.source: The user will not see the URL string probe site.
trans-unit.target: The user will not see the URL string probe site.

trans-unit.source: An example of a URL string probe is the address of an auditing Web server that checks device compliance before connecting the VPN.
trans-unit.target: An example of a URL string probe is the address of an auditing Web server that checks device compliance before connecting the VPN.

trans-unit.source: Another possibility is that the URL tests the ability of the VPN to connect to a site, before connecting the device to the target URL through the VPN.
trans-unit.target: Another possibility is that the URL tests the ability of the VPN to connect to a site, before connecting the device to the target URL through the VPN.

trans-unit.source: **Evaluate connection**, which has three settings a.
trans-unit.target: **Evaluate connection**, which has three settings a.

trans-unit.source: **Domain action** - choose **Connect if needed** or **Never connect** b.
trans-unit.target: **Domain action** - choose **Connect if needed** or **Never connect** b.

trans-unit.source: **Comma-separated list of domains** - you configure this only if you choose a **Domain action** of **Connect if needed** c.
trans-unit.target: **Comma-separated list of domains** - you configure this only if you choose a **Domain action** of **Connect if needed** c.

trans-unit.source: **Required URL string probe** - an HTTP or HTTPS (preferred) URL, such as *https://vpntestprobe.contoso.com*.
trans-unit.target: **Required URL string probe** - an HTTP or HTTPS (preferred) URL, such as *https://vpntestprobe.contoso.com*.

trans-unit.source: The rule will check to see if there's a response from this address.
trans-unit.target: The rule will check to see if there's a response from this address.

trans-unit.source: If not, and the **Domain action** is **Connect if needed**, the VPN will be triggered.
trans-unit.target: If not, and the **Domain action** is **Connect if needed**, the VPN will be triggered.

trans-unit.source: An example of when you might use this action is when some sites on your corporate network require a direct or VPN corporate network connection, but others do not.
trans-unit.target: An example of when you might use this action is when some sites on your corporate network require a direct or VPN corporate network connection, but others do not.

trans-unit.source: If you list in **Comma-separated list of DNS search domains** *corp.contoso.com*, you can choose **Connect if needed** and then list specific sites within that network that may require VPN, such as *sharepoint.corp.contoso.com*.
trans-unit.target: If you list in **Comma-separated list of DNS search domains** *corp.contoso.com*, you can choose **Connect if needed** and then list specific sites within that network that may require VPN, such as *sharepoint.corp.contoso.com*.

trans-unit.source: The rule will then check if *vpntestprobe.contoso.com* can be reached.
trans-unit.target: The rule will then check if *vpntestprobe.contoso.com* can be reached.

trans-unit.source: If it can't, the VPN will be triggered for the sharepoint site.
trans-unit.target: If it can't, the VPN will be triggered for the sharepoint site.

trans-unit.source: **Ignore** - this causes no change in the VPN connectivity.
trans-unit.target: **Ignore** - this causes no change in the VPN connectivity.

trans-unit.source: If the VPN is connected, leave it connected, if it's not connected, don't connect it.
trans-unit.target: If the VPN is connected, leave it connected, if it's not connected, don't connect it.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may have a rule that connects the VPN for all of your internal corporate web sites, but want to make one of those internal sites accessible only when the device is actually connected to the corporate network.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may have a rule that connects the VPN for all of your internal corporate web sites, but want to make one of those internal sites accessible only when the device is actually connected to the corporate network.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you would create an ignore rule for that one site.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you would create an ignore rule for that one site.

trans-unit.source: **Disconnect** - disconnect devices from the VPN when the conditions are matched.
trans-unit.target: **Disconnect** - disconnect devices from the VPN when the conditions are matched.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could list your corporate wireless networks in the **SSIDs** field, and create a rule that disconnects devices from the VPN when they connect to one of those networks.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could list your corporate wireless networks in the **SSIDs** field, and create a rule that disconnects devices from the VPN when they connect to one of those networks.

trans-unit.source: Domain-specific rules are evaluated before all-domain rules.
trans-unit.target: Domain-specific rules are evaluated before all-domain rules.

trans-unit.source: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy that you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy that you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: To deploy the policy, select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, and then choose **Add** > **OK**.
trans-unit.target: To deploy the policy, select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, and then choose **Add** > **OK**.

trans-unit.source: To close the dialog box without deploying it, choose **Cancel**.
trans-unit.target: To close the dialog box without deploying it, choose **Cancel**.

trans-unit.source: After successful deployment, users will see the VPN connection name that you specified in the list of VPN connections on their devices.
trans-unit.target: After successful deployment, users will see the VPN connection name that you specified in the list of VPN connections on their devices.

trans-unit.source: A status summary and alerts on the **Overview** page of the **Policy** workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
trans-unit.target: A status summary and alerts on the **Overview** page of the **Policy** workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
